intro: Crypsis juncea, commonly known as the slender cryptogram, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or greenish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Crypsis juncea is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
